text: I'm thinking to myself, I just love doing the art, it takes me a morning to do.
author: Eddie Campbell

text: I'm not a T.G.I.F. guy. I get off a plane at 2 o'clock in the morning and I'm looking for my secretary because I want to know what's going on.
author: Vijay Mallya

text: I go jogging for 25 minutes every morning, even if I'm away from home.
author: Pierre Dukan

text: At the very end of a book I can manage to work for longer stretches, but mostly, making stuff up for three hours, that's enough. I can't do any more. At the end of the day I might tinker with my morning's work and maybe write some again. But I think three hours is fine.
author: Peter Carey

text: I made that decision back in 1985. I was out here getting certified in SCUBA with Garcia in Kona and I thought to myself, this is a place to wake up in in the morning.
author: Bill Kreutzmann
